Quote: We've got a few options. First; round nuts. And some kind of oval shaped nuts? And some rock-shaped nuts, that might just be rocks.
Shouldn't we run away from huge booms? Not toward them?
Which means no nuts for dinner!
Hey! I worked hard to get those nuts! Yeah, I hate 'em too.
Great hat! I'll trade you some nuts for it.
They're crazy, Mom! I mean, look at how they're dressed.
Fire Nation! Act natural!
They're thugs. They steal from us. And everyone here's too much of a coward to do anything about it.
How can you say that? Haru has a gift! Asking him not to earthbend is like asking me not to waterbend. It's a part of who we are.
I understand that Haru can help you fight back. What can the Fire Nation do to you that they haven't done already?
My father was very courageous. When the Fire Nation invaded, he and the other earthbenders were outnumbered ten to one. But they fought back anyway.
Yeah. Problem is ... the only way I can feel close to my father now is when I practice my bending. He taught me everything I know.
I lost my mother in a Fire Nation raid. This necklace is all I have left of her.
Absolutely not! This village is crawling with Fire Nation troops. If they discover you're here, Aang, we'll be eating fireballs for breakfast. Goodnight.
I'd rather eat fireballs than nuts.
Because they're going to arrest me for earthbending.

I thought you were crazy at first, Katara, but this might work. There are ventilation shafts throughout these mines. All Aang has to do is send an air current from that vent to this one right here. The boulder levitates and ta-da! Fake earthbending.
Get out of my way, pipsqueak!
A giant-eared cretin! Look at those things! Do herds of animals use them for shade?!
I will not back off! I bet elephants get together and make fun of how large your ears are!
That lemur! He's earthbending!
Momo, you have some big ears!
She'll be fine, Aang. Katara knows what she's doing.
You've got guts, Katara. I'll give you that.
I'll talk to the guards. In the meantime, make sure the elderly are taken care of. The rest of us will simply have to hope for warmer weather.
Katara, I admire your courage. And I envy your youth. But people's lives are at stake here. The warden is a ruthless man, and he won't stand for any rebellion. I'm sorry, but we're powerless.

Earthbenders! You don't know me, but I know of you. Every child in my Water Tribe village was rocked to sleep with stories of the brave Earth Kingdom, and the courageous earthbenders who guard its borders.
Yes, they have taken away your ability to bend. But they can't take away your courage. And it is your courage they should truly fear!
It is the strength of your hearts that make you who you are. Hearts that will remain unbroken when all rock and stone has eroded away.
I'm not leaving. I'm not giving up on these people.
Well, sir, it looked like a flying bison.
It was a giant flying buffalo, sir. With an empty saddle.
Then wake up someone I haven't thrown overboard and search the rig! There's something going on here and I don't like it.
wish I knew how to make a hurricane!
Foolish girl. You thought a few inspirational words and some coal would change these people? Look at these blank, hopeless faces. Their spirits were broken a long time ago.
No, please! I can't swim!
Don't worry. I hear cowards float.
The Fire Nation will regret the day they set foot on our land!
